field.name: pf_user_scroll_switch
field.label: Infinite Scroll Active
field.description: When this box is checked, users can scroll through content continuously.

field.name: pf_user_menu_set
field.label: Show side menu
field.description: When this box is checked, a menu that includes a list of feeds with alerts displays on the right side of the All Content and Nominated pages.

field.name: pf_pagefull
field.label: Number of feed items per page.
field.description: Setting this number determines how many items will appear on the All Content and Nominated pages when infinite scroll is turned off.

field.name: pf_link_to_source
field.label: Seconds to redirect user to source. (0 means no redirect)
field.description: PressForward makes use of canonical URLs. If you would like to redirect your readers automatically to the items aggregated by the feed reader and published to your site, this setting will determine how long to wait before redirecting.

field.name: pf_use_advanced_user_roles
field.label: Use advanced user role management? (May be needed if you customize user roles or capabilities).
field.description: For sites that manage multiple users using special plugins, administrators can use this option to insure PressForward respects customized user roles and capacities.

field.name: pf_present_author_as_primary
field.label: Show item_author as source.
field.description: When this preference is on, the name of the author in a PressFoward item will appear in the item_author custom field when the item is sent to Draft. This author will overwrite the creator of the post.

field.name: pf_source_statement_position
field.label: Source statement position.
field.description: Choose the position for source title and link on published content.

field.name: pf_retain_time
field.label: Months to retrieve and retain feed items.
field.description: This number determines the number of previous months that PressForward will retrieve items for All Content from subscribed feeds and the number of months that items will remain in PressForward.

field.name: pf_errors_until_alert
field.label: Number of errors before a feed is marked as malfunctioning.
field.description: Feeds sometimes respond slowly or have errors that cause them to be unreadable. This setting determines the number of consecutive errors PressForward will allow from a feed before creating an alert and disabling it.

field.name: pf_retrieval_frequency
field.label: Minutes between feed retrieval cycles.
field.description: This setting is the frequency at which PressForward will attempt to start the process of retrieving all the feeds in your list. Warning: if you have a large number of feeds this setting should not go below 30 minutes.

field.name: pf_draft_post_status
field.label: Post status for new content.
field.description: This setting allows you to set a default post status that gets set when you send nominations to become posts.

field.name: pf_draft_post_type
field.label: Post type for new content.
field.description: Your WordPress site may have more than one Post Type installed, this setting will allow you to send nominations to the post type of your choice.

field.name: pf_comments_enable
field.label: Enable Internal Commenting
field.description: This provides a way for users to comment on posts throughout the editorial process. Internal commenting is only visible in the PressForward plugin and will not be publicly visible when published as a Post.

field.name: pf_debugger_enable
field.label: Enable Debugger Log Viewing
field.description: This provides a way to view the feed retrieval log within the dashboard.

field.name: pf_foo_enable
field.label: Enable Foo Test
field.description: This provides a set of test functions for developers to check.

field.name: pf_opml-subscribe_enable
field.label: Enable opml-subscribe
field.description: This module needs to overwrite the setup_module function and give a description.

field.name: pf_rss-import_enable
field.label: Enable RSS Import
field.description: This module provides the core functionality to read RSS feeds and translate them into PressForward's system.

field.name: pf_rss-out_enable
field.label: Enable RSS Output
field.description: This module provides a way to output RSS Feeds from your subscribed items. An RSS Feed consisting of all your subscribed items will be available at your domain '/pressforward.'
